de.mrapp.android.validation.validators.misc

Class IPv4AddressValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.validation.validators.AbstractValidator<java.lang.CharSequence>
      • de.mrapp.android.validation.validators.text.RegexValidator
        • de.mrapp.android.validation.validators.misc.IPv4AddressValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator<java.lang.CharSequence>

    public class IPv4AddressValidator
extends RegexValidator
    A validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IPv4 addresses. Empty texts are also accepted.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IPv4AddressValidator(java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage)
      Creates a new validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IPv4 addresses.

      Creates a new validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IPv4 addresses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IPv4AddressValidator

        public IPv4AddressValidator(java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage)
        Creates a new validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IPv4 addresses.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null

      • IPv4AddressValidator

        public IPv4AddressValidator(android.content.Context context,
                            @StringRes
                            int resourceId)
        Creates a new validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IPv4 addresses.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used to retrieve the error message, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        resourceId - The resource ID of the string resource, which contains the error message, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource ID must correspond to a valid string resource
